column4: how do I boot ubuntu so the graphics work on an nforce 680i system with sli?  I did the install with vga=77(something).. I could at least see the screen, but it was all messed up
when I do a normal boot, I see the initial screen where it loads the kernel.. then blank
I can wait a bit and hit ctrl-alt-del and it reboots, so I know it's booting.. I just don't see anything
What type of video card do you ahve?
Is this a fresh install?
when you get to grub menu hit esc and select recovery mode.
Okay now we need to figure out what drivers you need to fix X
yeah you need to select the proper driver in /etc/X11/xorg.conf You should be able to boot X with vesa drivers.  try dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg and select the vesa driver.
X is working now?
yeah it doens't hav ea background set if you use start x.
oh thats interesting.
well enable the nvidia restricted driver and reboot.  Let it boot normally you should get back in X
that vga=  line in grub just tells it what resolution to run the terminals in.
well if you boot to recovery mode and nano /boot/grub/menu.1st you can delete the vga= line
yes
when you get a root prompt type in nano /boot/grub/menu.lst
then you can delete the vga=775 or whatever from the end of your kernel line
ahh maybe its a problem with splash then.  Get rid of that.
you can take out splash and quiet from your main kernel line.
